total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that in the examples, the number 4 replaces the number 8 in the input grid when it is surrounded by 8s in a 3x3 square.
Q3: Determine the locations of all 3x3 squares in the input grid of the quiz where the center is 8 and all other numbers are also 8.
Q4: Replace the center number of these 3x3 squares with the number 4 to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that in the examples, the number 4 replaces the number 8 when it is surrounded by the number 6 on all sides.
Q3: Identify the cells in the input grid of the quiz that are surrounded by the number 6 on all sides.
Q4: Replace the number 8 in these cells with the number 4 to generate the output grid.

Q3: Determine the locations of all 3x3 squares in the input grid of the quiz where the center is 8 and all other numbers are also 8.
Q4: Replace the center number of these 3x3 squares with the number 4 to generate the output grid.
